# Georeferencing

## What is Georeferencing?

+ Letâ€™s say you took an aerial photo, or have an old map with no coordinate information and want to work with that in QGIS.
+ __Georeferencing__ is the process by which we ascribe real-world locations to non-GIS data. 
+ __Ground Control Points__ or GCPs are how we tell the computer which points on the non-georeferenced image correspond to real-world coordinates.

## Tutorial: Geoferencing the Treasure Map

::: {.r-stack}
::: {.fragment .fade-in-then-out}
:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="70%"}
+ Download treasure_map.tif
+ Open QGIS
+ `Layer` > `Georeferencer`
+ Open Raster
    + Select the file we downloaded
:::

::: {.column width="30%"}
![](img/raster_icon.png)
:::

::::

:::
::: {.fragment .fade-in-then-out}

![](img/treasure_map_processing.png){style="height: 500px;"}

:::
::: {.fragment .fade-in-then-out}
:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="60%"}
+ Open Transformation Settings 
+ Select `Polynomial 1` for `Transformation Type`
+ Set output file 
+ Click ok
:::

::: {.column width="40%"}
![](img/settings_icon.png)
![](img/transformation_settings.png)
:::

::::

:::

What geographic features are helpful for identifying?

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="60%"}

::: {style="font-size:0.7em"}
+ Once you find the place:
    + Add GCPs
    + Click a point on the image
    + The `Enter Map Coordinates` box should pop up
    + Select the `From Map Canvas` button
    + Click point
    + Click ok 
    + Repeat 4x
:::
